intro: Loranthus thollonii, commonly known as the African mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is native to sub-Saharan Africa. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its berries are typically red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Loranthus thollonii plays a role in the ecosystem by providing food for wildlife and influencing the growth of its host trees.
